creators.title: Creators
creators.description: The full name of the creators. The personal name format should be: family, given (e.g.: Smith, John).

given_name.title: Given name
given_name.description: The first names given to this entity.

family_name.title: Family name
family_name.description: The family names given to this entity.

affiliations.title: Affiliations
affiliations.description: The organisations or entities this entity is affiliated with.

affiliation_identifier.title: Identifier
affiliation_identifier.description: The unique identifier of the affiliation.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The scheme used for the identifier.

name_identifiers.title: Name identifiers
name_identifiers.description: The identifiers that point to any information about this creator.

name_identifier.description: The unique identifier of the entity, according to various identifier schemes.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The scheme used for the identifier.

scheme_uri.title: Scheme URI
scheme_uri.description: The URI pointing to the scheme.

titles.title: Titles
titles.description: The titles(s) of the uploaded resource, or a name by which the resource is known.

publisher.title: Publisher
publisher.description: The entity responsible for making the resource available, either a person, an organization, or a service.

publication_date.title: Publication date
publication_date.description: The date when the data was or will be made publicly available (e.g. 2018-07-13)

resource_type_description.title: Description
resource_type_description.description: An optional description of the resource type.

instruments.title: Instruments
instruments.description: The scientific instruments the data was generated or captured on.

instrument_identifier.title: Identifier
instrument_identifier.description: The unique identifier of the instrument.

disciplines.title: Disciplines
disciplines.description: The scientific disciplines linked with the resource.

discipline_identifier.title: Identifier
discipline_identifier.description: The unique identifier of the discipline, according to various identifier schemes.

classification_code.title: Code
classification_code.description: The corresponding classification code of the discipline, according to various identifier schemes.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The scheme used for the identifier.

scheme_uri.title: Scheme URI
scheme_uri.description: The URI pointing to the scheme.

keywords.title: Keywords
keywords.description: The keywords or key phrases describing the resource.

classification_code.title: Code
classification_code.description: The corresponding classification code of the keyword, according to various identifier schemes.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The scheme used for the identifier.

scheme_uri.title: Scheme URI
scheme_uri.description: The URI pointing to the scheme.

contributors.title: Contributors
contributors.description: The list of all other contributors. Please mention all persons that were relevant in the creation of the resource.

given_name.title: Given name
given_name.description: The first names given to this entity.

family_name.title: Family name
family_name.description: The family names given to this entity.

affiliations.title: Affiliations
affiliations.description: The organisations or entities this entity is affiliated with.

affiliation_identifier.title: Identifier
affiliation_identifier.description: The unique identifier of the affiliation.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The scheme used for the identifier.

name_identifiers.title: Name identifiers
name_identifiers.description: The identifiers that point to any information about this creator.

name_identifier.description: The unique identifier of the entity, according to various identifier schemes.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The scheme used for the identifier.

scheme_uri.title: Scheme URI
scheme_uri.description: The URI pointing to the scheme.

languages.title: Languages
languages.description: The language(s) of the contents of the resource. Allowed values should be taken from ISO 639-1 and 639-3 language codes or IETF BCP 47. Examples: en, de or deu, eng or de-AT, en-US.

language_identifier.title: Identifier
language_identifier.description: The identifier for the language, according to various identifier schemes.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The scheme used for the identifier.

scheme_uri.title: Scheme URI
scheme_uri.description: The URI pointing to the scheme.

alternate_identifiers.title: Alternate identifier
alternate_identifiers.description: The alternative identifiers for this resource such as a URN, URI or an ISBN number.

related_identifiers.title: Related identifiers
related_identifiers.description: The identifiers of other resources related to the resource such as a URN, URI or an ISBN number.

relation_type.title: Relation
relation_type.description: The relation type of the described reference.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The scheme used for the identifier.

scheme_uri.title: Scheme URI
scheme_uri.description: The URI pointing to the scheme.

descriptions.title: Descriptions
descriptions.description: The more elaborate description of the resource. Focus on a content description that makes it easy for others to find, and to interpret its relevance.

contact_email.title: Contact email
contact_email.description: The contact email information for this resource.

open_access.title: Open access
open_access.description: Indicate whether the record's files are publicly accessible or not. In case of restricted access the uploaded files will only be accessible by the record's owner and the community administrators. Please note that the record's metadata is always publicly accessible.

embargo_date.title: Embargo date
embargo_date.description: The date marking the end of the embargo period. The record will be marked as open access on the specified date at midnight. Please note that the record metadata is always publicly accessible, and only the data files can have private access.

license.title: License
license.description: The license under which this data set is available to the users (e.g. GPL, Apache v2 or Commercial). Please use the License Selector for help and additional information.

license_uri.title: License URI
license_uri.description: The URI pointing to the description of the license.

license_identifier.title: Identifier
license_identifier.description: The unique identifier of the license, according to various identifier schemes.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The scheme used for the identifier.

scheme_uri.title: Scheme URI
scheme_uri.description: The URI pointing to the scheme.

dates.title: Dates
dates.description: The dates related to the resource

date_information.title: Date information
date_information.description: The additional information about the date.

sizes.title: Sizes
sizes.description: The unstructured size information about the resource

formats.title: Formats
formats.description: The technical formats of the resource.

spatial_coverages.title: Spatial coverages
spatial_coverages.description: The spatial coverages of the contents of the resource.

place.title: Place
place.description: The name of a place or location.

point.title: Point

point_vertical.title: Vertical
point_vertical.description: The vertical position of the point.

point.description: A point contains a single latitude-longitude pair.

box.title: Boxes
box.description: A bounding box defined by two points.

westbound_longitude.title: Westbound longitude
westbound_longitude.description: The westbound longitude of the enclosing box.

eastbound_longitude.title: Eastbound longitude
eastbound_longitude.description: The eastbound longitude of the enclosing box.

northbound_latitude.title: Northbound latitude
northbound_latitude.description: The northbound latitude of the enclosing box.

southbound_latitude.title: Southbound latitude
southbound_latitude.description: The southbound latitude of the enclosing box.

polygons.title: Polygons
polygons.description: One or more drawn polygon areas, defined by a set of points and lines connecting the points in a closed chain.

polygon.title: Polygon
polygon.description: A drawn polygon area, defined by a set of points and lines connecting the points in a closed chain.

point_vertical.title: Vertical
point_vertical.description: The vertical position of the point.

point_vertical.title: Vertical
point_vertical.description: The vertical position of the point.

temporal_coverages.title: Temporal coverages
temporal_coverages.description: The temporal coverage of the contents of the resource.

ranges.title: Ranges
ranges.description: The temporal ranges of the contents of the resource.

start_date.title: Start date
start_date.description: The start date and time of the range covered by the resource.

end_date.title: End date
end_date.description: The end date and time of the range covered by the resource.

spans.title: Spans
spans.description: The named spans of the contents of the resource.

items.description: The name of the span covered by the data in the resource.

funding_references.title: Funding references
funding_references.description: The information about financial support (funding) for the resource being registered.

funder_name.title: Funder name
funder_name.description: The full name of the funder.

funder_identifier.description: The unique identifier of the funder.

funder_identifier_type.title: Type
funder_identifier_type.description: The type of the identifier of the funder.

scheme_uri.title: Scheme URI
scheme_uri.description: The URI pointing to the scheme.

award_number.title: Award number
award_number.description: The corresponding number of the award.

award_uri.title: Award URI
award_uri.description: The URI pointing to the award.

community.title: Community
community.description: The community to which the record has been submitted.

_pid.title: Persistent Identifiers
_pid.description: Array of persistent identifiers pointing to this record.

oeb_id.description: The unique identifier of the dataset, provided by OEB API
oeb_id.title: Dataset ID

oeb_community.description: Acronym defined in OEB for the benchmarking community - ideally, should match the one used in the benchmarking data model
oeb_community.title: Community OEB acronym

oeb_dataset_version.description: Version (or release date) of the metadata
oeb_dataset_version.title: Version
